question: With respect to Geomorphology, what are ‘Inselbergs’?
option1: Desert counterpart of the delta formed due to depositional aeolian action
option2: Residual hills formed due to erosional aeolian action
option3: Semi-circular steepsided depression formed through depositional glacial action
option4: Landform created due to combined action of fluvial erosional and depositional
answer: Residual hills formed due to erosional aeolian action
explanation: Inselberg are similar to the monadnocks found in peneplains.They are formed due to erosional aeolian action.
